intro: Nothopanax murrayi, commonly known as Murray's nothopanax, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually palmately lobed, and the flowers are greenish-white with five petals. Nothopanax murrayi is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
